forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
Problem is that most probably, since your laptop is not USB booting capable, the order of drives is NOT what the program expects.  

On a "normal USB booting" PC, the USB drive becomes first disk (when you boot from it) and internal hard disk becomes second one.  
On your "PLoP USB booting" PC, probably the USB drives remains SECOND disk and the internal one remains FIRST one.  

Try editing one of the entries in BOOT.INI as follows:  
> multi(0)disk(0)rdisk(***0***)partition(1)\\WINDOWS="Second part of XP Professional setup from hd 0 part 1" /FASTDETECT

Or change the grub4dos menu.lst on the stick NOT to exchange drives.  

The "other" approach:  
[http://www.msfn.org/.../2-t121446.html](http://www.msfn.org/board/2-t121446.html "External link")  

should give you no problems.  

As well, the good ol' way through DOS (which has a few limitations and needs some basic DOS knowledge) should work allright:  
[http://www.911cd.net...showtopic=16713](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=16713 "External link")  

![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  

jaclaz

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
Basically that menu.lst "redirects" to winsetup.lst, so you need to post that file, additionally. But you also need to access command line (when in menu.lst) and find out which is which. just press "c" and then issue these commands: ``` find (hd0)/ ``` \[TAB\] ``` find (hd1)/ ``` \[TAB\] to list the files in first and second disk, that should tell you which is which.
jaclaz
